title: Tottenham vs Chelsea LIVE : Premier League latest updates as Oliver Skipp scores first Spurs goal
body_text:
Tottenham vs Chelsea LIVE: Premier League result and final score after Harry Kane and Oliver Skipp goals
Follow live updates as Tottenham host Chelsea in the Premier League, with Graham Potter‚Äôs side desperate for a win in today‚Äôs London derby.
Chelsea have won just twice in their last 14 Premier League matches, a woeful run of form that dipped even further following last weekend‚Äôs 1-0 home defeat to Southampton, and face a Spurs side who were lifted by their victory over West Ham last time out.
The result moved Tottenham into the top four and Antonio Conte‚Äôs side can tighten their grip on fourth spot with another three points this afternoon, although the Italian will be missing from the sideline once again.
Chelsea‚Äôs top-four hopes are slim and defeat would surely close the door for good. It would also increase the pressure on Potter‚Äôs position. The Chelsea manager revealed on Friday that he and his family have been subjected to death threats amid his side‚Äôs poor run but defeat at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium would be a further test of the club‚Äôs patience.
Follow live updates from Tottenham vs Chelsea in the Premier League, below
Tottenham vs Chelsea LIVE: Latest Premier League updates
Tottenham host Chelsea in Premier League
Chelsea are without a win in five in all competitions, Tottenham can go four points clear of Newcastle
46‚Äô GOAL! - Skipp rockets Spurs into the lead (TOT 1-0 CHE)
45+5‚Äô RED CARD OVERTURNED - Ziyech is sent off, then recalled after VAR check (TOT 0-0 CHE)
43‚Äô SHOT! - Sterling darts in and unleashes a right-footed effort that Forster keeps out (TOT 0-0 CHE)
27‚Äô POST - Hojbjerg‚Äôs deflected effort strikes the post (TOT 0-0 CHE)
19‚Äô INJURY - Thiago Silva forced off early after challenge on Harry Kane (TOT 0-0 CHE)
Tottenham Hotspur FC 2 - 0 Chelsea FC
FT Tottenham 2-0 Chelsea
15:37 , Michael Jones
Oliver Skipp‚Äôs goal was scored 19 seconds into the second half, the earliest such goal in a Premier League game since Gerard Deulofeu for Watford vs West Ham in May 2019 (45:11).
Full-time: Tottenham 2-0 Chelsea
15:30 , Michael Jones
90+6 mins: It‚Äôs another defeat for Chelsea! Goals from Oliver Skipp and Harry Kane are enough to earn Spurs the win and moves them four points clear of Newcastle in fourth place.
Chelsea have now gone six games without a win. Graham Potter‚Äôs tenure continues to grow ever worse.
Tottenham 2-0 Chelsea
15:26 , Michael Jones
90+3 mins: Corner to Chelsea! Mudryk takes the corner and whips the ball onto the head of the first defender. Ben Chilwell then gives the ball away and Pedro Porro curls a long crossfield pass over to the left wing by Son Heung-min gives up on his run.
Chelsea recover possession.
Tottenham 2-0 Chelsea
15:24 , Michael Jones
90 mins: There‚Äôs still a bit of hope for Chelsea as six minutes of stoppage are shown on the board. The Blues need to score soon though.
They are knocking on the door and have plenty of men up the pitch to pressure the Spurs defence.
Tottenham 2-0 Chelsea
15:22 , Michael Jones
88 mins: Spurs are sitting back now, allowing Chelsea to control possession. Wesley Fofana gets forward on the right wing before flicking a cross into the middle of the six-yard box.
Aubmeyang is hovering but can‚Äôt get his head to it and Spurs work it away.
Pedro Porro comes on to replace Richarlison.
Tottenham 2-0 Chelsea
15:18 , Michael Jones
85 mins: Mykhailo Mudryk and Pierre-Emerick Auabmeyang come on for Chelsea to replace Raheem Sterling and Joao Felix. Graham Potter‚Äôs men are staring down the barrel of another defeat here.
A goal for the visitors could spark a late revival though.
GOAL! Tottenham 2-0 Chelsea (Kane, 82‚Äô)‚öΩÔ∏è
15:16 , Michael Jones
82 mins: Spurs have their second! Son whips the corner kick into the middle of the box and picks out the head of Eric Dier. He nods the ball over to the back post where Harry Kane is wide open and pokes home a simple tap in.
That should be enough for Tottenham to win this one.
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
15:14 , Michael Jones
81 mins: Inside the last 10 minutes at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. Son Heung-min has come on to replace Dejan Kulusevski for Spurs as Richarlison wins a corner.
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
15:11 , Michael Jones
78 mins: Chelsea are showing a bit of fight. Sterling slips the ball into the box as Havertz sneaks in behind. He then threads the ball into the six-yard area and wins a corner.
The set piece comes to nothing though.
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
15:08 , Michael Jones
75 mins: Cristian Romero dallies with the ball and is charged down by Kai Havertz. Romero has to lunge at the ball to poke it away from Havertz and in the process takes down the Chelsea forward.
Mason Mount is fuming over the challenge and has words with the referee who, equipment now restored, books him for dissent.
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
15:05 , Michael Jones
72 mins: There‚Äôs a break in play as the referee jogs off the pitch to replace some of his equipment which must be faulty.
Oliver Skipp‚Äôs driving effort is the only difference between the teams as the match enters the final 20 minutes or so.
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
15:01 , Michael Jones
69 mins: Lovely play from Chelsea! They work the ball down the left side with Zakaria and Felix linking-up nicely in a string of one-touch passes.
Felix sends it inside to Mount who flicks the ball into the penalty area for Havertz. The forward keeps himself onside and sprints after the ball but is beaten to it but a sprawling Fraser Forster who smothers the danger.
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
14:59 , Michael Jones
66 mins: If Tottenham go on to win this game then they‚Äôll move four points clear of Newcastle in fourth place. Chelsea are languishing in 10th and have no momentum at all.
Harry Kane receives the ball on the right side of the pitch and lifts a cross into the box. Ben Davies is free on the opposite side but the pass is just too far away from him.
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
14:56 , Michael Jones
63 mins: Yep. Denis Zakaria and Mason Mount are introduced to replace Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Hakim Ziyech. Will they have enough influence on this game to swing it Chelsea‚Äôs way?
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
14:53 , Michael Jones
60 mins: Chelsea have only scored 23 goals in the Premier League this season and they‚Äôre in desperate need of one now.
Kai Havertz nods a long ball down to Joao Felix who drills a shot towards goal from the edge of the box but his effort is blocked by Eric Dier.
It looks as though Potter is going to make a double change.
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
14:51 , Michael Jones
56 mins: There‚Äôs a lot of deliberating in between Graham Potter and his coaching staff in the Chelsea dugouts. Denis Zakaria is getting prepped and ready to come on.
Chelsea haven‚Äôt responded to going behind yet at all.
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
14:47 , Michael Jones
53 mins: Penalty shout! Emerson Royal has been impressive today for Spurs. He carries the ball into the box from the right and lays it off to Skipp.
Skipp looks to lift it into a more central position and his kick strikes Koulibaly on the arm. Spurs appeal for a handball but the referee waves them away.
Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea
14:46 , Michael Jones
50 mins: Oliver Skipp‚Äôs goal came 20 seconds into the second half. It‚Äôs put Tottenham firmly in control of the game and they‚Äôre making use of the lead.
The home side have come out with an attacking mindset and are pushing for a second.
GOAL! Tottenham 1-0 Chelsea (Skipp, 46‚Äô)‚öΩÔ∏è
14:41 , Michael Jones
46 mins: Yes we will! Tottenham get Emerson Royal free on the right side of the box and he forces Kepa Arrizabalaga into a low save.
Chelsea then fail to properly clear their lines and chip the ball out to Oliver Skipp who wins it ahead of Joao Felix.
Skipp guides the ball back into the box before unleashing a rocket at the goalkeeper. His effort hits the underside of the crossbar and bounces over the line! Kepa had no chance.
Tottenham take the lead.
Second half: Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
14:39 , Michael Jones
Tottenham get the ball rolling for the second half. Will we see some goals in this next 45 minutes?
HT Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
14:28 , Michael Jones
Half-time: Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
14:24 , Michael Jones
45+6 mins: Nothing to separate the teams at half-time. Chelsea will feel relieved that Hakim Ziyech is still on the pitch. He earned himself a red card for a shove on Emerson Royal but VAR came to the right decision to overturn it.
All to play for in the second half.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
14:22 , Michael Jones
45+5 mins: Hang on a minute! Hakim Ziyech is told not to leave the pitch as the VAR check is still ongoing. A couple more minutes pass before the referee is then told to rescind the red card and give Ziyech a yellow instead.
Chelsea have a reprieve. It‚Äôs the correct decision as Ziyech only pushed Royal and didn‚Äôt mean to catch him on the chin.
Red card! Ziyech is sent off!
14:21 , Michael Jones
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
45+3 mins: It‚Äôs all kicking off after Hakim Ziyech fouls Richarlison. The Brazilian reacts and squares up with Ziyech before Clement Lenglet and Emerson Royal get involved.
Royal shoulders into Ziyech who responds with a forceful shove. He hits Royal in the shoulder before following through and striking him on the face
VAR takes a look at the incident and the referee pulls out a red card!
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
14:15 , Michael Jones
45 mins: Three minutes of added time to play at the end of the first half. Will there be an opening goal before the break?
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
14:14 , Michael Jones
43 mins: Save! Wesley Fofana drives in between Harry Kane and Dejan Kulusevski with the ball before fizzing a cross field pass over to Raheem Sterling.
Sterling cuts inside from the left and smokes a right-footed shot towards goal forcing Fraser Forster into a sharp save to his left.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
14:11 , Michael Jones
39 mins: Chance! Ben Davies brings the ball into the final third and links up with Harry Kane. Hakim Ziyech pounces on a loose ball but Richarlison nicks it back off him.
The Brazilian weaves into the box from the left and tries to curl a shot towards the far corner only to mishit the effort and belt it wide.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
14:08 , Michael Jones
36 mins: After his antics with Kepa Arrizabalaga, Harry Kane is on the receiving end of some similar treatment. The ball is played into his feet with his back to goal.
Kane thinks about turning but Wesley Fofana is on top of his in a flash. He clatters into the Spurs captain and puts him to the floor when clearing his lines.
No complaints and a rye smile from Harry Kane after that one.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
14:05 , Michael Jones
33 mins: The Tottenham fans are annoyed as Kepa Arrizabalaga takes his time getting the ball moving. He received it in open play so there is no time-wasting going on as Spurs don‚Äôt bother to close him down.
He eventually rolls the ball over to Ben Chilwell who returns the pass. Kepa switches the play to the opposite wing and is shouldered to the floor by a late Harry Kane challenge.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
14:01 , Michael Jones
30 mins: Tottenham have grown into the game as expected. They were wary and watchful in the first 20 minutes or so but have started to open up having defended against Chelsea‚Äôs early attacks.
The home side win another corner that Dejan Kulusevski takes short. Chelsea have numbers back though and head the ball away when the cross eventually comes in.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
13:59 , Michael Jones
27 mins: Off the post! Richarlison brings the ball inside from the left side and links-up with Harry Kane for a one-two. The Brazilian is brought down just outside the ball but the referee plays advantage as the ball comes loose to Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.
He blazes a shot at goal and hits Weslel Fofana who attempts to get in the block. The ball deflects to the left of Kepa Arrizabalaga and spins onto the right-hand post before bouncing clear!
Best chance of the half goes to Spurs.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
13:54 , Michael Jones
24 mins: Every now and again Tottenham press high to put Chelsea under pressure at the back. Reece James drifts inside and receives the ball just as Richarlison bombs forward.
The defender is always in control and blocks Richarlison with his body before releasing a pass. The Brazilian runs into James and sends him to the deck earning Chelsea a free kick.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
13:51 , Michael Jones
21 mins: Thiago Silva isn‚Äôt able to continue. It seems as though he tweaked something when defending against Kane‚Äôs dribble into the Chelsea box.
Wesley Fofana is introduced to replace him.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
13:49 , Michael Jones
18 mins: Shot! Chelsea flick the ball over to Hakim Ziyech on the right side of the pitch and he heads it on to Kai Havertz. Havertz brings the ball under control, shifts it away from the nearest defender then slides a pass over to Joao Felix.
He lets fly from range and leaves Fraser Forster with an easy save.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
13:46 , Michael Jones
15 mins: This could be a blow foe Chelsea. Thiago Silva has gone down after turning the ball out of play. The corner is yet to be taken as the Blues‚Äô centre-back receives some treatment.
Kulusevski whips the set piece into the box but it flies through to Oliver Skipp. He floats the ball back into the middle and Kepa Arrizabalaga is fouled trying to pluck it out of the air.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
13:44 , Michael Jones
12 mins: It‚Äôs been a bright start from Chelsea. They‚Äôve had 67% possession over these opening stages. Raheem Sterling bombs down the left flank and lifts a cross into the box.
Hakim Ziyech nods it over towards Kai Havertz but Cristian Romero completes the clearance and Spurs break forward on the counter-attack.
Kane, Richarlison and Dejen Kulusevski all combine to get the ball into the penalty area before Kane wins a corner.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
13:41 , Michael Jones
9 mins: Joao Felix loses the ball in midfield and goes to ground claiming that he was hit in the face. The referee doesn‚Äôt buy the acting and lets play go on.
Harry Kane floats a pass over to the left side of the box where it get nodded down to Richarlison. He looks the control the ball and shoot but Thiago Silva blocks his way and clears the danger.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
13:38 , Michael Jones
6 mins: Nearly! Chelsea are getting stuck into the game early on here. Ruben Loftus-Cheek carries the ball into the final third before sliding it across to Enzo Fernandez as Spurs drop off and sit in.
Fernandez flicks the ball into the box as Joao Felix storms in behind from the right. He lunges towards the dropping ball but it just evades his volley effort and bounces through for a goal kick.
Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
13:35 , Michael Jones
3 mins: Penalty shout! Raheem Sterling dances his way into the left side of the Tottenham penalty area. He runs into trouble but Oliver Skipp is clumsy with his attempted clearance.
He kicks out and catches Sterling‚Äôs leg allowing the Chelsea man to go down. The referee says no penalty but VAR takes a look at the incident before coming to the same conclusion.
Kick off: Tottenham 0-0 Chelsea
13:31 , Michael Jones
Chelsea kick off the match at the Tottenham Hotspur stadium. They send the ball towards the back line where it gets shifted over to Ben Chilwell.
He feeds a nice pass into midfield for Joao Felix who dinks one over the top but sends the ball bobbling through to Fraser Forster.
Pre-match thoughts from Cristian Stellini
13:26 , Michael Jones
Tottenham assistant head coach Cristian Stellini, spoke to Sky Sports ahead of kick off and explained why Son Heung-min starts on the bench today:
‚ÄúWe have to keep the momentum. It is a good moment for us. We have worked well in the week, we hope we will play a good game and the energy we need to do that is important.
‚ÄúIt was a difficult decision [to keep Son on the bench] but it was not the only decision we had to take - we had many. We are lucky we had Antonio [Conte] to help us make the decision and we are happy with the team.‚Äù
Will Kane find the target again?
13:23 , Michael Jones
Harry Kane‚Äôs last 11 goals for Spurs in all competitions were scored in London.
Kane and Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg could become the first Spurs players to score home and away league goals against Chelsea in the same season since Gary Lineker in 1990/91.
Blues struggling away from home
13:19 , Michael Jones
Chelsea‚Äôs nine away games without a victory in all competitions is their longest such run since a 17-match streak from April 2000 to January 2001.
The Blues are winless in all 10 league fixtures this season against the teams that began this round of fixtures above them in the table - they are currently 10th and Spurs 4th.
Chelsea giving full backing to Graham Potter after poor run of results
13:15 , Michael Jones
Chelsea boss Graham Potter has the full support of the club‚Äôs hierarchy despite his side‚Äôs poor run of results.
The Blues have won just twice in 14 games in all competitions and were beaten by the Premier League‚Äôs bottom side Southampton at Stamford Bridge on Saturday.
Potter‚Äôs expensively-assembled side left the pitch amidst anger and a chorus of boos at full-time, with some voices near the dugout calling for the former Brighton manager to leave.
However, it is understood that Potter maintains the backing of co-controlling owners Todd Boehly and Behdad Eghbali ahead of Sunday‚Äôs London derby at Tottenham.
Chelsea giving full backing to Graham Potter after poor run of results
Son the super-sub
13:11 , Michael Jones
Son Heung-min has scored four goals in two substitute appearances in the Premier League this season, compared to just one goal in his 20 starts.
No Spurs player has ever scored five from the bench in a Premier League campaign.
Tottenham vs Chelsea
13:07 , Michael Jones
Only Manchester City‚Äôs league matches have produced more goals this season than the 79 scored in Tottenham‚Äôs fixtures.
Spurs have conceded multiple goals in 13 Premier League matches this season, a joint top-flight high with Leicester City.
In contrast, the 46 goals that have been scored in Chelsea‚Äôs 23 league games is the fewest involving any top-flight side this season.
Chelsea‚Äôs shocking form
13:03 , Michael Jones
Chelsea have only won one of their 10 matches in all competitions in 2023, and just two of their last 14 league games. They have scored eight goals in those 14 matches, the fewest of any side during that run.
They are aiming to avoid a run of six games without a win in all competitions for the first time since November to December 2012.
Potter on mental health issues and threat to his family
12:59 , Michael Jones
This is Graham Potter‚Äôs 18th Premier League match in charge of Chelsea since he was appointed five months ago.
He has won just five of those game resulting in the worst parts of the Chelsea fanbase to hurl anonymous abuse at him and his family online.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve had some not particularly nice emails come through, that want me to die,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs obviously not pleasant to receive.
‚ÄúYou could ask my family how life has been for me and for them. It‚Äôs been not pleasant at all. If you go to work and somebody‚Äôs swearing abuse at you, it‚Äôs not going to be pleasant.
‚ÄúWith the results as they are, you accept criticism. That‚Äôs not to say it‚Äôs easy at all. Your family life suffers, your mental health suffers, your personality - it is hard.‚Äù
Three in a row?
12:55 , Michael Jones
Spurs are aiming for three consecutive Premier League home wins without conceding for the first time since their opening three matches at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium back in April 2019.
They could also set a club record of 23 consecutive home league games without a draw.
Tottenham vs Chelsea
12:51 , Michael Jones
Spurs could claim four points in a season from Chelsea for only the second time in the Premier League, having done so in 2008/09.
This is also the 150th league meeting between the sides. Tottenham have won 47, Chelsea 64, and there has been 38 draws.
Enzo Fernandez interview: ‚ÄòMy message to the Chelsea fans? Trust us‚Äô
12:47 , Michael Jones
Enzo Fernandez still remembers the times. ‚ÄúFour hours difference in winter, three hours in summer - we knew exactly,‚Äù he says, going back to the Sunday mornings where he would get up early and crawl into bed with his dad to watch the Premier League.
It was there, drinking Mate ‚Äì a South American herbal drink ‚Äì, where he would tune in to see his Argentinian heroes ‚Äì ‚ÄúKun Aguero, Carlos Tevez, Higuain‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Äì but in San Martin, Buenos Aires, those stadiums of Stamford Bridge and Old Trafford seemed a world away. Now, though, it is Enzo Fernandez, a World Cup winner at 22, who stands above them as the most expensive Premier League player of all time.
All journeys to the Premier League are remarkable ‚Äì but Fernandez‚Äôs has been defined by an astonishing and dizzying assent. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all gone very, very quickly,‚Äù he admits, speaking through a translator ‚Äì although he has now started English lessons.
He is happy to be here at Chelsea although the move to London ‚Äì a ‚Äúbeautiful city,‚Äù he says ‚Äì with his young family has not been easy. Fernandez is staying in a hotel as he has yet to find a house, but he is settling into his new surroundings following his third move in less than a year.
The rise of Enzo Fernandez and World Cup winner‚Äôs message to Chelsea fans
Tottenham vs Chelsea
12:43 , Michael Jones
Tottenham have won just seven of their 61 Premier League games against Chelsea and are winless in the last eight top-flight meetings.
Chelsea are looking to become just the third team to win four consecutive away league games against Tottenham, emulating Arsenal (1952/55) and Manchester United (six between 2001/07).
Tottenham vs Chelsea
12:39 , Michael Jones
It‚Äôs a contrasting point of view looking at these two teams. Tottenham are looking to win consecutive games and move four points clear of Newcastle to keep a grip on fourth spot - and a Champions League place - while Chelsea are just searching for a win.
Graham Potter‚Äôs men have not won in five matches across all competitions and lost 1-0 to the bottom placed side in the Premier League, Southampton, last time out.
A victory over Tottenham will go some way to easing the pressure on the manager but the Blues need to string together a run of wins to move up the table.
Tottenham vs Chelsea team news
12:35 , Michael Jones
Tottenham Hotspur are unchanged from the team that started their 2-0 victory over West Ham last time out. Harry Kane leads the line once more with Richarlison out on the left in place of Son Heung-min.
Graham Potter meanwhile makes six changes to the Chelsea side that lost to Southampton in their last outing. Reece James and Thiago Silva return to the defence.
Ruben Loftus-Cheek slots in alongside Enzo Fernandez in midfield with starts for Raheem Sterling, Hakim Ziyech and Kai Havertz.
Tottenham vs Chelsea line-ups
12:31 , Michael Jones
Tottenham XI: Forster, Romero, Dier, Lenglet, Emerson, Skipp, Hojbjerg, Davies, Kulusevski, Richarlison, Kane
Unchanged for #TOTCHE üëä pic.twitter.com/Qx0SwK7lBL
‚Äî Tottenham Hotspur (@SpursOfficial) February 26, 2023
Chelsea XI: Arrizabalaga, James, Thiago Silva, Koulibaly, Chilwell, Loftus-Cheek, Fernandez, Sterling, Felix, Ziyech, Havertz
Your Chelsea side today! üí™@ParimatchGlobal | #TotChe pic.twitter.com/0bVOrTm4Ff
‚Äî Chelsea FC (@ChelseaFC) February 26, 2023
Chelsea manager Graham Potter says he and children subjected to death threats
12:25 , Michael Jones
Chelsea promised to offer Graham Potter whatever support he needs after the manager was sent emails threatening him and his family.
Potter said he had been targeted by an anonymous account in the wake of the team‚Äôs recent poor form, which continued with a 1-0 home defeat by Southampton last Saturday.
Afterwards some supporters behind the dugout at Stamford Bridge called for the manager to leave, with the atmosphere turning increasingly hostile as the game wore on. Personal attacks on social media have also increased following the loss to Saints, but those have now escalated to threats being sent to him directly.
Potter, who has said previously that he believes he has the hardest job in football, was nevertheless visibly upbeat ahead of his team‚Äôs trip to Tottenham on Sunday, joking that he was late as he had been at a ‚Äúcrisis meeting‚Äù with the club‚Äôs owners.
Chelsea manager Graham Potter says he and children subjected to death threats
Tottenham vs Chelsea prediction
12:20 , Michael Jones
These are two unpredictable teams at present but Tottenham seem in slightly less disarray so could well edge this contest.
Tottenham 2-1 Chelsea.
Tottenham vs Chelsea predicted line-ups
12:15 , Michael Jones
Tottenham XI: Forster; Romero, Dier, Lenglet; Emerson, Skipp, Hojbjerg, Davies; Kulusevski, Kane, Son
Chelsea XI: Kepa; James, Silva, Badiashile, Chilwell; Kovacic, Fernandez; Mudryk, Felix, Sterling; Havertz
What is the team news?
12:10 , Michael Jones
The likes of Rodrigo Bentancur, Yves Bissouma, Hugo Lloris and Ryan Sessegnon are all out injured for Spurs, while Oliver Skipp is likely to partner Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg in midfield.
Ben Davies could continue at left-wing back and Son Heung-min is likely to replace Richarlison.
Cesar Azpilicueta‚Äòs serious head injury suffered against Southampton will keep him out, while Armando Broja, Christian Pulisic and Edouard Mendy are also absent. N‚ÄôGolo Kante is now back in team training although is likely not yet fit enough to feature.
Mykhaylo Mudryk, Raheem Sterling and Kai Havertz will all be pushing for a start in attack, while Thiago Silva and Reece James shoudl start in defence.
How to watch Tottenham vs Chelsea
12:05 , Michael Jones
The match will kick off at 1.30pm GMT on Sunday 26 February. It will be shown live on Sky Sports Main Event and Sky Sports Premier League.
If you‚Äôre not a Sky customer you can grab a NOWTV Day Pass here to watch without a subscription.
We may earn commission from some of the links in this article, but we never allow this to influence our content. This revenue helps to fund journalism across The Independent.
Good afternoon
11:59 , Michael Jones
Good afternoon and welcome to live coverage of Tottenham vs Chelsea in the Premier League, with Graham Potter‚Äôs side desperate for a win in today‚Äôs London derby.
Chelsea have won just twice in their last 14 Premier League matches, a woeful run of form that dipped even further following last weekend‚Äôs 1-0 home defeat to Southampton, and face a Spurs side who were lifted by their victory over West Ham last time out. The result moved Tottenham into the top four and Antonio Conte‚Äôs side can tighten their grip on fourth spot with another three points this afternoon, although the Italian will be missing from the sideline once again.
Chelsea‚Äôs top-four hopes are slim and defeat would surely close the door for good. It would also increase the pressure on Potter‚Äôs position. The Chelsea manager revealed on Friday that he and his family have been subjected to death threats amid his side‚Äôs poor run but defeat at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium would be a further test of the club‚Äôs patience.
Follow live updates from Tottenham vs Chelsea in the Premier League in today‚Äôs live blog
